root.pub-comments: "Except for Opon, Yupka, Pimenteira and Palmela (and possibly Panare), the Kariban languages are not very diverse phonologically and lexically (though more so than Romance, for example). The groups recognized here reflect either a consensus of the opinions of the various attempts at classification, or evidence I have found that supports one classifier against all the others. In each case the languages included in a group are probably quite closely related." (76)
root.publications: Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 75-76. London, New York: Routledge.
